content.description:
If youre really tall (or have a crazy ape index) you need to come do this one. I'm 5'10" and this one is just out of reach for me. 

  Start at the base of the dark vertical jug crack at the left side of the blank short roof. Use any feet and make the crazy long span to the slopey right side of the boulders arête. 

  Do some bouldering magic and link up to the start moves of "Fringe Traverse" and finish as per

Sit start to the low right side of the boulders arête lip on small crimps. Use the low heel hook chunk for a right heel placement off of the start. 

  Follow the arête up past slopers and crimps to the juggy apex of the boulder at the tip of the roof. Press over with a fun but tough all-out mantle.

This one is a great warm-up for "Fringe Traverse" or the "Fringe Benefits Project". 

  Start under the roof in the back of the deep crack seam. Work out of the roof using any feet and "top out" over the easy terrain. This version is V0...  

  For a v1-2 ending work right to avoid the easy ending and press out the full-on mantle by working right and only using the right roof lip for the end of this line as well (finish with the mantle for "Fringe Traverse" & "Benefits")... Or do it twice and do both!

This short little roof is right off of the trail. While its not much, it has two nice lines and a tough project. It's located just off of the trail in and right before you get to the Ginseng area.  

  The landing isnt bad although there are some ankle grabbing hole under the leaves (Ill try to fill those in some next time Im there) to watch out for.
